title: Question 1
question: (FUNIVERSA 2015) Knowing the position of urinary organs and not injuring them during evisceration is necessary if the doctor wishes to dissect them for study. The ureter descends from the kidneys to the urinary bladder, located in the pelvis, in an anterior position and following the path of the

title: Question 2
question: (FUNIVERSA 2015) According to Dangelo and Fattini in Basic Human Anatomy, “the simple observation of a human group immediately reveals morphological differences between the elements that make up the group”. Based on this information, check the alternative that presents the name of these differences.

title: Question 3
question: (UFG 2015) There are ligaments found in the knee joint:

options.label: Fibular collateral, medial retinaculum, annular radius.

title: Question 4
question: (UFG 2015) The structures of the nasal cavity are:

options.label: Nasal bone, tubal torus, vocal fold.
Vocal fold, nasal septum, alar cartilage

title: Question 5
question: (UFG 2015) When dissecting the forearm region, the following superficial veins are visualized:

title: Question 6
question: (UFG 2015) When removing the brain from the corpse with instruments, after sectioning the scalp and muscles, a horizontal semicircular and binaural cut of the skull is performed and the skullcap is removed. What is the anatomical structure seen just below the skullcap?

title: Question 7
question: (UFG 2015) When removing the thoracic visceral block, the following organs are visualized:

question: (UFG 2015) The bones of the tarsus are:

question: (UFG 2015) The nerves responsible for lower limb innervation are:

title: Question 10
question: (UFG 2015) The tunics that line the testicles are:

title: Question 11
question:
(FCM-MG 2020) The joints present between the bones of the upper limb allow movement between various axes and anatomical planes and are described according to the shape or type of material by which bones are joined.
The joint classified as syndesmosis is found in the upper limb among the bones:

title: Question 12
question:
(FCM-MG 2020) The organ related to the sense of hearing is the ear, which is subdivided into the ear outer ear, middle ear and inner ear, containing their respective components.
The organ of Corti, which presents the hearing receptors, is located in the inner ear

title: Question 13
question:
(FCM-MG 2020) Craniometric points are important bone reference points, used mainly in forensic medicine and cephalometric analysis.
The nasion is a craniometric point that is located at the point:

options.label: Inferior of the piriform opening at the base of the anterior nasal spine.
Against the sagittal suture with the coronal suture.
Against the internal suture and the fronto-nasal suture.
Above the fronto-nasal suture between the superciliary arches.

title: Question 14
question:
(FCM-MG 2020) The femoral trigone is a subfascial space of triangular shape, which contains the femoral nerve, femoral artery and vein. It is a useful reference point for understanding the inguinal region.
As for the limits of the femoral triangle, it is CORRECT to state that:

options.label: The upper limit is formed by the inguinal ligament that forms the base of the femoral triangle.
The trine floor is formed by the sartorius muscle and the long adductor muscle.
The medial limit is formed by the iliopsoas and pectineal muscles
The lateral limit is formed by the medial margin of the adductor magnus muscle.

title: Question 15
question:
(FCM-MG 2020) Often, novice students are frustrated because the bodies examined or dissected are not the same as the atlas or textbook. Some anatomical variations are important in clinical practice and especially in surgery.
Regarding anatomical variations and their importance, check the CORRECT alternative.

options.label: Anatomical variation generally has no effect on normal function.
Approximately 0.1% of newborns have one or more abnormalities significant birth defects.
The nerves have the largest anatomical variations and the veins, the smallest variations.
There is no variation in the size, shape and mode of insertion of the muscles.

title: Question 16
question:
(FCM-MG 2020) The circulatory system carries fluid throughout the body. It is formed by the heart, blood vessels and lymph vessels.
Tick ​​the CORRECT alternative on that system.

options.label: Carbon dioxide is exchanged for oxygen in the pulmonary capillaries and the blood rich in oxygen is brought back through the pulmonary veins of the lungs to the right atrium of the heart.
The left ventricle drives oxygen-rich blood, which arrives from the lungs to the body through the inferior and superior vena cava.
The heart consists of a muscle pump with a left side and a right side that they work in a relay system, sending blood to the body and lungs.
The circuit from the left ventricle to the right atrium is the systemic circulation.

title: Question 17
question: (FCM-MG 2020) The eye is the organ of vision, formed by the eye bulb and the optic nerve. The orbit contains the eye bulb and accessory vision structures. About the eye and its function, check the CORRECT alternative.

options.label: The eyelids protect the eye from injury, excessive lighting and maintain the cornea wet by spreading the tear fluid.
The lacrimal bone is not one of the orbit-forming.
The apex of the orbit in the minor wing of the sphenoid bone contains the ophthalmic canal.
The iris, which is literally on the back of the lens, has several openings, the largest of them called pupil.

title: Question 18
question: (FCM-MG 2020) Check the CORRECT alternative corresponding to the arteries responsible for all blood flow in the hand.

options.label: Deep brachial artery and circumflex elbow artery.
Brachial artery and anterior interosseous artery.
Common interosseous artery and brachial artery.

title: Question 19
question: (FUNRIO 2015) The teaching of human anatomy can be done through the systemic approach, which considers the different organs of the human body organized into functional and integrated systems and devices. Check the option that correctly indicates the names of the organs or their portions, and the name of the organ system to which they belong.

options.label: Respiratory system - bronchi, thymus and lungs.
Digestive system - stomach, transverse colon, pharynx and larynx.
Central nervous system - brain, cerebellum and nervous ganglia.
Integumentary system - skin and its attachments.
Endocrine system - spleen, thymus, duodenum, pancreas and liver.

title: Question 20
question: (IDECAN 2014) To study human anatomy it is necessary to know the so-called anatomical planes, as they are fundamental to better understand the human body and its components. Thus, the location and situation of the different organs of the body will be facilitated. There are the planes that cut (cut) and others that only delimit (tangent) the body.
